page.title: 11THE UNDERCLIFF WALK
page.content: The undercliff walk is a well-used part of Rottingdean reached by steps through a natural gap in the cliffs extending westwards to Brighton and eastwards to Saltdean. Apart from attractive sea views, Brighton Marina and many yachts can be seen, with Worthing clearly visible. The undercliff walk lies between the base of the cliffs and the coastal defence wall. The chalk cliffs with numerous veins of flint form an impressive coastline and reach roughly 35 metres in height. The cliffs are subject to collapse and notices to that effect warn the public. The beach has fairly large pebbles, although at low tide large expanses are sandy areas.
